english_translation: Sharikas chirped, sitting within the houses of the Vrishnis. The noise made by those birds ceased not for even a short while by day or by night.

source_text: अन्वकुर्वन्नुलूकानां सारसा विरुतं तथा। अजाः शिवानां विरुतमन्वकुर्वत भारत॥७॥

source_text: पाण्डुरा रक्तपादाश्च विहगाः कालचोदिताः। वृष्ण्यन्धकानां गेहेषु कपोता व्यचरंस्तदा॥८॥

english_translation: Many birds appeared, moved by Death, which were pale of color, but that had legs red of hue. Pigeons were seen to always disport in the houses of the Vrishni.

english_translation: Asses were born of kine, and elephants of mules. Cats were born of bitches, and mouse of the mungoose.

english_translation: The destroyer of Keshi, viz., Janardana, thinking upon the omens that Time showed, understood that the thirty-sixth year had come, and that what Gandhari, burning with grief on account of the death of her sons, and deprived of all her kinsmen, had said was about to take place.

english_translation: The present is exactly similar to that time which Yudhishthira had marked at sight of those dreadful omens which appeared when the two armies were arranged in battle-order.

source_text: एष गच्छामि पदवीं सत्येन च तथा शपे। सौप्तिके ये च निहताः सुप्ता येन दुरात्मना॥२६॥
matched_target_text: एष गच्छामि पदवीं सत्येन च तथा शपे। सौप्तिके ये च निहताः सुप्ता येन दुरात्मना॥
english_translation: Then rising up in anger, Satyaki said, 'I swear to your by Truth that I shall soon cause this one to follow the five sons of Draupadi, and of Dhrishtadyumna and Shikhandin, they, viz., who were killed by this sinful wretch, while they were asleep, with the help of Drona's son, O you of slender wish, Kritavarman's period of life and fame has come to an end.'

source_text: द्रोणपुत्रसहायेन पापेन कृतवर्मणा। समाप्तमायुरस्याद्य यशश्चैव सुमध्यमे॥२७॥
matched_target_text: द्रोणपुत्रसहायेन पापेन कृतवर्मणा। समाप्तमायुरस्याद्य यशश्चैव सुमध्यमे॥
english_translation: Then rising up in anger, Satyaki said, 'I swear to your by Truth that I shall soon cause this one to follow the five sons of Draupadi, and of Dhrishtadyumna and Shikhandin, they, viz., who were killed by this sinful wretch, while they were asleep, with the help of Drona's son, O you of slender wish, Kritavarman's period of life and fame has come to an end.'

source_text: इत्येवमुक्त्वा खड्गेन केशवस्य समीपतः। अभिद्रुत्य शिरः क्रुद्धश्चिच्छेद कृतवर्मणः॥२८॥
matched_target_text: इत्येवमुक्त्वा खड्ड्रेन केशवस्य समीपतः। अभिद्रुत्य शिरः क्रुद्धश्चिच्छेद कृतवर्मणः॥
english_translation: Having said these words, Satyaki rushed at Kritavarman and cut off his head with a sword in the very sight of Keshava.

source_text: तथाऽन्यानपि निघ्नन्तं युयुधानं समन्ततः। अभ्यधावद्धृषीकेशो विनिवारयितुं तदा॥२९॥
matched_target_text: तथाऽन्यानपि निघ्नन्तं युयुधानं समन्ततः । अभ्यधावद्धृषीकेशो विनिवारयितुं तदा ॥

sarit_reference.text: तथाऽन्यानपि निघ्नन्तं युयुधानं समन्ततः । अभ्यधावद्धृषीकेशो विनिवारयितुं तदा ॥

ce_reference.text: तथान्यानपि निघ्नन्तं युयुधानं समन्ततः अभ्यधावद्धृषीकेशो विनिवारयिषुस्तदा

source_text: एकीभूतास्ततः सर्वे कालपर्यायचोदिताः। भोजान्धका महाराज शैनेयं पर्यवारयन्॥३०॥
matched_target_text: एकीभूतास्ततः सर्वे कालपर्यायचोदिताः। भोजान्धका महाराज शैनेयं पर्यवारयन्॥
english_translation: At that time, however, O king, the Bhojas and Andhakas moved by the perverseness of the hour that had come upon them, all became as one man and surrounded the son of Shini.

source_text: तान्दृष्ट्वा पततस्तूर्णमभिक्रुद्धाज्जनार्दनः। न चुक्रोध महातेजा जानन्कालस्य पर्ययम्॥३१॥
matched_target_text: तान् दृष्ट्वा पततस्तूर्णमभिक्रुद्धाञ्जनार्दनः। न चुक्रोध महातेजा जानन् कालस्य पर्ययम्॥
english_translation: Janardana of great energy, knowing the character of the hour stood unmoved without giving way to anger, seeing those heroes rushing in anger at Satyaki from every side.

source_text: ते तु पानमदाविष्टाश्चोदिताः कालधर्मणा। युयुधानमथाभ्यघ्नन्नुच्छिष्टैर्भाजनैस्तदा॥३२॥
matched_target_text: ते तु पानमदाविष्टाश्चोदिताः कालधर्मणा । युयुधानमथाभ्यघ्नन्नुच्छिष्टैर्भाजनैस्तदा ॥

sarit_reference.text: ते तु पानमदाविष्टाश्चोदिताः कालधर्मणा । युयुधानमथाभ्यघ्नन्नुच्छिष्टैर्भाजनैस्तदा ॥

ce_reference.text: ते तु पानमदाविष्टाश्चोदिताश्चैव मन्युना युयुधानमथाभ्यघ्नन्नुच्छिष्टैर्भाजनैस्तदा

source_text: हन्यमाने तु शैनेये क्रुद्धो रुक्मिणिनन्दनः। तदनन्तरमागच्छन्मोक्षयिष्यन् शिनेः सुतम्॥३३॥
matched_target_text: हन्यमाने तु शैनेये क्रुद्धो रुक्मिणिनन्दनः। तदनन्तरमागच्छन्मोक्षयिष्यन् शिनेः सुतम्॥ स भोजैः सह संयुक्तः सात्यकिश्चान्धकैः सह।
english_translation: When the son of Shini was being thus assaulted, Rukmini's son became greatly enraged. he rushed forward for rescuing Satyaki who was engaged with the Bhojas and the Andhaks.

source_text: स भोजैः सह संयुक्तः सात्यकिश्चान्धकैः सह। व्यायच्छमानौ तौ वीरौ बाहुद्रविणशालिनौ॥३४॥
matched_target_text:
स भोजैः सह संयुक्तः सात्यकिश्चान्धकैः सह ।
							व्यायच्छमानौ तौ वीरौ बाहुद्रविणशालिनौ । बहुत्वान्निहतौ तत्र उभौ कुष्णस्य पश्यतः ॥

sarit_reference.text:
स भोजैः सह संयुक्तः सात्यकिश्चान्धकैः सह ।
							व्यायच्छमानौ तौ वीरौ बाहुद्रविणशालिनौ । बहुत्वान्निहतौ तत्र उभौ कुष्णस्य पश्यतः ॥

source_text: बहुत्वान्निहतौ तत्र उभौ कृष्णस्य पश्यतः। हतं दृष्ट्वा च शैनेयं पुत्रं च यदुनन्दनः॥३५॥
matched_target_text: व्यायच्छमानौ तौ वीरौ बाहुद्रविणशालिनौ॥ बहुत्वात्रिहतौ तत्र उभौ कृष्णस्य पश्यतः।
english_translation: Gifted with might of arms and w’alth of energy, those two heroes acted with great courage. But as the odds were overwhelming, both of them were killed before the very eyes of Krishna.

source_text: एरकानां ततो मुष्टिं कोपाज्जग्राह केशवः। तदभून्मुसलं घोरं वज्रकल्पमयोमयम्॥३६॥
matched_target_text: हतं दृष्ट्वा च शैनेयं पुत्रं च यदुनन्दनः॥ एरकानां ततो मुष्टिं कोपाज्जग्राह केशवः।
english_translation: Seeing his own son, and the son of Shini too, killed, the delighter of the Yadus took up, in anger, a handful of the Eraka grass which grew there.

source_text: जघान कृष्णस्तांस्तेन ये ये प्रमुखतोऽभवन्। ततोऽन्धकाश्च भोजाश्च शैनेया वृष्णयस्तथा॥३७॥
matched_target_text: तदभून्मुसलं घोरं वज्रकल्पमयोमयम्॥ जघान कृष्णस्तांस्तेन ये ये प्रमुखतोऽभवन्।
english_translation: That handful of grass became a terrible bolt of iron gifted with the energy of the thunderbolt. With it Krishna destroyed all those who came before him.

source_text: जघ्नुरन्योन्यमाक्रन्दे मुसलैः कालचोदिताः। यस्तेषामेरकां कश्चिज्जग्राह कुपितो नृप॥३८॥
matched_target_text: ततोऽन्धकाश्च भोजाश्च शैनेया वृष्णयस्तथा॥ जघ्नुरन्योन्यमाक्रन्दे मुसलैः कालचोदिताः।
english_translation: Then the Andhakas and the Bhojas, the Shaineyas and the Vrishnis, urged by Time, struck one another in that dreadful right.

source_text: वज्रभूतेव सा राजन्नदृश्यत तदा विभो। तृणं च मुसलीभूतमपि तत्र व्यदृश्यत॥३९॥
matched_target_text: यस्तेषामेरकां कश्चिज्जग्राह कुपितो नृप॥ वज्रभूतेव सा राजन्नदृश्यत तदा विभो।
english_translation: Indeed, O king, whoever amongst them took up in anger a few blades of the Eraka grass, these, in his hands, became soon converted into a thunder-bolt, O powerful one.

source_text: ब्रह्मदण्डकृतं सर्वमिति तद्विद्धि पार्थिव। अविध्यान् विध्य ते राजन् प्रक्षिपन्ति स्म यत्तृणम्॥४०॥
matched_target_text: तृणं च मुसलीभूतमपि तत्र व्यदृश्यत॥ ब्रह्मदण्डकृतं सर्वमिति तद् विद्धि पार्थिव।
english_translation: Every blade of grass there was seen to be converted into a terrible iron bolt. All this, know, O king, was due to the curse imprecated by Brahmanas.

source_text: तद्वज्रभूतं मुसलं व्यदृश्यत तदा दृढम्। अवधीत्पितरं पुत्रः पिता पुत्रं च भारत॥४१॥
matched_target_text: अविध्यान् विध्यते राजन् प्रक्षिपन्ति स्म यत् तृणम्॥ तद् वज्रभूतं मुसलं व्यदृश्यत तदा दृढम्।
english_translation: He who hurled a blade of grass saw that it pierced through even such things as were utterly impenetrable. In fact, every blade was seen to become a dreadful bolt having the force of thunder.

source_text: मत्ताः परिपतन्ति स्म योधयन्तः परस्परम्। पतंगा इव चाग्नौ ते निपेतुः कुकुरान्धकाः॥४२॥
matched_target_text: अवधीत् पितरं पुत्रः पिता पुत्रं च भारत॥ मत्ता परिपतन्ति स्म योधयन्तः परस्परम्।
english_translation: Son killed father, and father killed son, O Bharata! Inebriated with wine, they rushed and fell upon one another.

source_text: नासीत्पलायने बुद्धिर्वध्यमानस्य कस्यचित्। तत्रापश्यन्महाबाहुर्जानन्कालस्य पर्ययम्॥४३॥
matched_target_text: पतङ्गा इव चाग्नौ ते निपेतुः कुकुरान्धकाः॥ नासीत् पलायने बुद्धिर्वध्यमानस्य कस्यचित्।
english_translation: The Kukuras and the Andhakas met with destruction like insects rushing at a burning fire. As they were thus being destroyed, no one among them thought of escaping by flight.

source_text: मुसलं समवष्टभ्य तस्थौ स मधुसूदनः। साम्बं च निहतं दृष्ट्वा चारुदेष्णं च माधवः॥४४॥
matched_target_text: तत्रापश्यन्महाबाहुर्जानन् कालस्य पर्ययम्॥ मुसलं समवष्टभ्य तस्थौ स मधुसूदनः।
english_translation: Knowing that the hour of destruction had come, the mighty-armed Keshava stood there, seeing everything. Indeed, the destroyer of Madhu stood, raising a bolt of Iron formed of a blade of grass.

source_text: प्रद्युम्नं चानिरुद्धं च ततश्चुक्रोध भारत। गदं वीक्ष्य शयानं च भृशं कोपसमन्वितः॥४५॥
matched_target_text: साम्बं च निहतं दृष्ट्वा चारुदेष्णं च माधवः॥ प्रद्युम्नं चानिरुद्धं च ततश्चुक्रोध भारत।
english_translation: Seeing that Shamba was killed, as also Charudeshna and Pradyumna and Aniruddha, Madhava became filled with anger.

source_text: स निःशेषं तदा चक्रे शार्ङ्गचक्रगदाधरः। तन्निघ्नन्तं महातेजा बभ्रुः परपुरञ्जयः॥४६॥
matched_target_text: गदं वीक्ष्य शयानं च भृशं कोपसमन्वित॥ स निःशेषं तदा चक्रे शार्ङ्गचक्रगदाधरः।
english_translation: Seeing Gada lying dead on the ground, his anger became enhanced. The holder Sharnaga and the discus and the mace then rooted the Vrishnis and the Andhakas.

source_text: दारुकश्चैव दाशार्हमूचतुर्यन्निबोध तत्। भगवन्निहताः सर्वे त्वया भूयिष्ठशो नराः। रामस्य पदमन्विच्छ तत्र गच्छाम यत्र सः॥४७॥
matched_target_text: भगवन्निहताः सर्वे त्वया भूयिष्ठशो नराः । रामस्य पदमन्विच्छ तत्र गच्छाम यत्र सः ॥ ॥

वैशम्पायन उवाच।
              ततो ययुर्दारुकः केशवश्च बभ्रुश्च रामस्य पदं पतन्तः। अथापश्यन् राममनन्तवीर्यं वृक्षे स्थितं चिन्तयानं विविक्ते॥१॥
matched_target_text: गत्वा कुरुन् वैशम्पायन उवाच ततो ययुर्दारुकः केशवश्च बभ्रुश्च रामस्य पदं पतन्तः। अथापश्यन् राममनतवीर्ये वृक्षे स्थितं चिन्तयानं विविक्ते॥
english_translation: Vaishampayana said, Then Daruka, Keshava and Vabhru left that place following Rama. They saw that hero of great energy sitting thoughtfully, reclining his back against at tree, in a solitary place.

source_text: ततः समासाद्य महानुभावं कृष्णस्तदा दारुकमन्वशासत्। गत्वा कुरून्सर्वमिमं महान्तं पार्थाय शंसस्व वधं यदूनाम्॥२॥
matched_target_text: ततः समासाद्य महानुभावं कृष्णस्तदा दारुकमन्वशासत्। सर्वमिमं महान्तं पार्थाय शंसस्व वधं यदूनाम्॥
english_translation: Finding Rama of great soul, Krishna ordered Daruka, saying, 'Going to the Kurus, inform Partha of this great carnage of the Yadus.

source_text: ततो गते दारुके केशवोऽथ दृष्ट्वान्तिके बभ्रुमुवाच वाक्यम्। स्त्रियो भवान्रक्षितुं यातु शीघ्रं नैता हिंस्युर्दस्यवो वित्तलोभात्॥४॥
matched_target_text: ततो गते दारुके केशवोऽथ दृष्ट्वान्तिके बभ्रुमुवाच वाक्यम्। स्त्रियो भवान् रक्षितुं यातु शीघ्र नैता हिंस्युर्दस्यवो वित्तलोभात्॥
english_translation: After Daruka had departed, Keshava, seeing Vabhru waiting on him, told him these words 'Do you go speedily for protecting the ladies. Let not robbers do them any injury, tempted by the riches.

source_text: स प्रस्थितः केशवेनानुशिष्टो मदातुरो ज्ञातिवधार्दितश्च। तं विश्रान्तं सन्निधौ केशवस्य दुरन्तमेकं सहसैव बभ्रुम्॥५॥
matched_target_text: स प्रस्थितः केशवेनानुशिष्टो मदातुरो ज्ञातिवधार्दितश्च। तं विश्रान्तं संनिधौ केशवस्य दुरन्तमेकं सहसैव बभ्रम्॥ ब्रह्मानुशप्तमवधीन्महद् वै कूटे युक्तं मुसलं लुब्धकस्य।
english_translation: Thus orderded by Keshava, Vabhru still helpless with wine but cheerless at the destruction of his kinsmen, wen away. He had rested for a while by the side of Keshava, but as soon as he had gone to a distance the ironbolt, attached to a mallet in the hands of a hunter, suddenly sprang of itself upon that solitary survivor of the Yadava family and killed him who also had been included in the curs of the Brahmans.

source_text: ब्रह्मानुशप्तमवधीन्महद्वै कूटे युक्तं मुसलं लुब्धकस्य। ततो दृष्ट्वा भिहतं बभ्रुमाह कृष्णोऽग्रजं भ्रातरमुग्रतेजाः॥६॥
matched_target_text: ततो दृष्ट्वा निहतं बभ्रुमाह कृष्णोऽग्रजं भ्रातरमुग्रतेजाः॥ इहैव त्वं मां प्रतीक्षस्व राम यावत् स्त्रियो ज्ञातिवशाः करोमि।
english_translation: Seeing Vabhru killed, Keshava of great energy addressed his elder brother and said, 'Do you, O Rama, wait for me her till I put the ladies under the care of kinsmen.

source_text: इहैव त्वं मां प्रतीक्षस्व राम यावत्स्त्रियो ज्ञातिवशाः करोमि। ततः पुरीं द्वारवतीं प्रविश्य जनार्दनः पितरं प्राह वाक्यम्॥७॥
matched_target_text: ततः पुरीं द्वारवतीं प्रविश्य जनार्दनः पितरं प्राह वाक्यम्॥ स्त्रियो भवान् रक्षतु नः समग्रा धनञ्जयस्यागमनं प्रतीक्षन्।
english_translation: Entering the city of Dvaravati, Janardana said these words to his father, 'Do you protect all the ladies of our house till Dhananjaya comes.

source_text: स्त्रियो भवान्रक्षतु नः समग्रा धनञ्जयस्यागमनं प्रतीक्षन्। रामो वनान्ते प्रतिपालयन्मामास्तेऽद्याहं तेन समागमिष्ये॥८॥
matched_target_text: रामो वनान्ते प्रतिपालयन्मा मास्तेऽद्याहं तेन समागमिष्ये॥ दृष्टं मयेदं निधनं यदूनां राज्ञां च पूर्वं पुरुपुङ्गवानाम्।
english_translation: At the skirts of the forest Rama is waiting for me. I shall meet him today. This great destruction of the Yadus has been seen by me even as I beheld before the carnage of those Kshatriyas who were the foremost ones of Kuru's race.

source_text: दृष्टं मयेदं निधनं यदूनां राज्ञां च पूर्वं कुरुपुङ्गवानाम्। नाहं विना यदुभिर्यादवानां पुरीमिमामशकं द्रष्टुमद्य॥९॥

english_translation: After his brother had thus gone from the (human) world, Vasudeva of celestial vision, who was fully acquainted with the end of all things, wandered for sometime in that solitary forest thoughtfully. Gifted with great energy he then sat down on the naked earth.

english_translation: After his brother had thus gone from the (human) world, Vasudeva of celestial vision, who was fully acquainted with the end of all things, wandered for sometime in that solitary forest thoughtfully. Gifted with great energy he then sat down on the naked earth.

english_translation: He had thought before this of everything which had been foreshadowed by the words uttered by Gandhari in former days. He also recollected the words that Durvasas had spoken at the time his body was smeared by that Rishi with the residue of the Payasa he had eaten.

source_text: मेने ततः सङ्क्रमणस्य कालं ततश्चकारेन्द्रियसन्निरोधम्। तथा च लोकत्रयपालनार्थमात्रेयवाक्यप्रतिपालनाय॥२०॥
matched_target_text: स चिन्तयन्नन्धकवृष्णिनाशं कुरुक्षयं चैव महानुभावः॥ मेने ततः संक्रमणस्य कालं ततश्चकारेन्द्रियसंनिरोधम्।
english_translation: The high-souled one, thinking of the destruction of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas, as also of the previous destruction of the Kurus, concluded that the hour (for his own departure from the world) had come. He then controlled his senses (in Yoga).

source_text: देवोऽपि सन् देहविमोक्षहेतोर्निर्णीतमैच्छत्सकलार्थतत्त्ववित्। स सन्निरुद्धेन्द्रियवाङ्मनास्तु शिश्ये महायोगमुपेत्य कृष्णः॥२१॥

english_translation: Knowing the truth of every topic, Vasudeva, though he was the Supreme Deity, wished to die for removing all doubts and establishing a certainty of results, simply for upholding the three worlds and for making the words of Atri's son true.

source_text: जराऽथ तं देशमुपाजगाम लुब्धस्तदानीं मृगलिप्सुरुग्रः। स केशवं योगयुक्तं शयानं मृगासक्तो लुब्धकः सायकेन॥२२॥
matched_target_text: स संनिरुद्धेन्द्रियवाङ्मनास्तु शिश्ये महायोगमुपेत्य कृष्णः॥ जराथ तं देशमुपाजगाम लुब्धस्तदानीं मृगलिप्सुरुग्रः।
english_translation: Having controlled all his senses, speech, and mind Krishna laid himself down in high Yoga. A fierce hunter of the name of Jara then came there, for finding a deer.

source_text: जराऽविध्यत्पादतले त्वरावांस्तं चाभितस्तज्जिघृक्षुर्जगाम। अथापश्यत्पुरुषं योगयुक्तं पीताम्बरं लुब्धकोऽनेऽकबाहुम्॥२३॥

english_translation: The hunter mistaking Keshava, who was stretched on the earth in high Yoga, for a deer, pierced at him at the heel with an arrow and quickly came to that spot for capturing his prey.

source_text: मत्वाऽऽत्मानं त्वपराद्धं स तस्य पादौ जरा जगृहे शङ्कितात्मा। आश्वासयंस्तं महात्मा तदानीं गच्छन्नूर्ध्वं रोदसी व्याप्य लक्ष्म्या॥२४॥
matched_target_text: अथापश्यत् पुरुषं योगयुक्तं पीताम्बरं लुब्धकोऽनेकबाहुम्॥ मत्वाऽऽत्मानं त्वपराद्धं स तस्य पादौ जरा जगृहे शंकितात्मा।
english_translation: Coming up, Jara saw a man dressed in yellow robes, rapt in Yoga, and gifted with many arms. considering himself an offender, and filled with fear, he touched the feet of Keshava.

source_text: दिवं प्राप्तं वासवोऽथाश्विनौ च रुद्रादित्या वसवश्चाथ विश्वे। प्रत्युद्ययुर्मुनयश्चापि सिद्धा गन्धर्वमुख्याश्च सहाप्सरोभिः॥२५॥

english_translation: When he reached the celestial region, Vasava and the twin Ashvins and Rudra and the Adityas and and the Vasus and the Visuvedevas, and Munis and Siddhas and many foremost ones among the Gandharvas, with the Apsaras, advanced to receive him.

source_text: ततो दैवेर्ऋषिभिश्चापि कृष्णः समागतश्चारणैश्चैव राजन्। गन्धर्वाग्र्यैरप्सरोभिर्वराभिः सिद्धैः साध्यैश्चानतैः पूज्यमानः॥२७॥
matched_target_text: ततो देवैर्ऋषिभिश्चापि कृष्णः समागतश्चारणैश्चैव राजन्। गन्धवौय्यैरप्सरोभिर्वराभिः सिद्धैः साध्यैश्चानतैः पूज्यमानः॥
english_translation: Krishna then met the deities and (celestial) Rishis and Charanas, O king, and the foremost ones among the Gandharvas and many beautiful Apsaras and Siddhas and Saddhyas. All of them bending in humility, adored him.

source_text: तं वै देवाः प्रत्यनन्दन्त राजन्मुनिश्रेष्ठा ऋग्भिरानर्चुरीशम्। तं गन्धर्वाश्चापि तस्थुः स्तुवन्तः प्रीत्या चैनं पुरुहूतोऽभ्यनन्दत्॥२८॥
matched_target_text: तं वै देवाः प्रत्यनन्दन्त राजन् मुनिश्रेष्ठा ऋम्भिरानचुरीशम्। तं गन्धर्वाश्चापि तस्थुः स्तुवन्तः प्रीत्या चैनं पुरुहूतोऽभ्यनन्दत्॥
english_translation: The celestials all saluted him, O monarch, and many foremost of ascetics and Rishi adored him as the Lord of all. The Gandharvas waited on him, singing his praises, and Indra also joyfully praised him.

source_text:
वैशम्पायन उवाच।

source_text: श्रुत्वा विनष्टान्वार्ष्णेयान् सभोजान्धककौकुरान्। पाण्डवाः शोकसन्तप्ता वित्रस्तमनसोऽभवन्॥२॥
matched_target_text: श्रुत्वा विनष्टान् वार्ष्णेयान् सभोजान्धककौकुरान्। पाण्डवाः शोकसंतप्ता वित्रस्तमनसोऽभवन्॥
english_translation: Hearing that the Vrishnis along with the Bhojas and Andhakas and Kukuras had all been killed, the Pandavas, burning with grief, became highly moved.

source_text: ततोऽर्जुनस्तानामन्त्र्य केशवस्य प्रियः सखा। प्रययौ मातुलं द्रष्टुं नेदमस्तीति चाब्रवीत्॥३॥

source_text: स वृष्णिनिलयं गत्वा दारुकेण सह प्रभो। ददर्श द्वारकां वीरो मृतनाथामिव स्त्रियम्॥४॥
matched_target_text: स वृष्णिनिलयं गत्वा दारुकेण सह प्रभो। ददर्श द्वारकां वीरो मृतनाथामिव स्त्रियम्॥
english_translation: Proceeding to the city of the Vrishnis with Daruka in his company, O powerful king, that hero saw that the city of Dwraka looked liked a women left of her husband.

source_text: या स्म ता लोकनाथेन नाथवन्त्यः पुराऽभवन्। तास्त्वनाथास्तदा नाथं पार्थं दृष्ट्वा विचुक्रुशुः॥५॥
matched_target_text: याः स्म ता लोकनाथेन नाथवन्त्यः पुराभवन्। तास्त्वनाथास्तदा नाथं पार्थं दृष्ट्वा विचुक्रुशुः॥
english_translation: Those ladies who had, before this, the very Lord of the universe for their protector, were now lordless. Seeing that Partha, had come for protecting them, they all bewailed aloud.

source_text: षोडश स्त्रीसहस्राणि वासुदेवपरिग्रहः। तासामासीन्महान्नादो दृष्ट्वैवार्जुनमागतम्॥६॥
matched_target_text: षोडशस्त्रीसहस्राणि वासुदेवपरिग्रहः। तासमासीन्महान् नादो दृष्टैवार्जुनमागतम्॥
english_translation: Sixteen thousand ladies had been wedded to Vasudeva. Indeed, as soon as they beheld Arjuna arrive, they uttered a loud cry of sorrow.

source_text: तास्तु दृष्ट्वैव कौरव्यो बाष्पेणापिहितेक्षणः। हीनाः कृष्णेन पुत्रैश्च नाशकत्सोऽभिवीक्षितुम्॥७॥
matched_target_text: तास्तु दृष्ट्वैव कौरव्यो बाष्पेणापिहितेक्षणः। हीनाः कृष्णेन पुत्रैश्च नाशकत् सोऽभिवीक्षितुम्॥
english_translation: As soon as the Kuru prince met those beautiful ladies deprived of the protection of Krishna and of their sons as well he was unable to look at them, vision being obstructed by tears.

source_text: स तां वृष्ण्यन्धकजलां हयमीनां रथोडुपाम्। वादित्ररथघो षौघां वेश्मतीर्थमहाह्रदाम्॥८॥
matched_target_text: स तां वृष्णयन्धकजलां हयमीनां रथोडुपाम्। वादित्ररथघोषौघां वेश्मतीर्थमहाह्रदाम्॥
english_translation: The Dwraka-river had the Vrishnis and the Andhakas for its water, horses for its fishes, cars for its rafts, the sound of musical instruments and the rattle of cars for its wayes, houses and mansions and public squares for its lakes. Games and precious stones were its moss. The walls of adamant were the garlands of flowers that floated on it. The streets and roads were the strong currents running in eddies along its surface. The great open squares were the large lakes in its course. Rama and Krishna were its two mighty alligators. That agreeable river now seemed to Arjuna to be the dreadful Vaitarani bound up with Time's net.

source_text: रत्नशैवलसङ्घातां वज्रप्राकारमालिनीम्। रथ्यास्रोतोजलावर्त्तां चत्वरस्तिमितह्रदाम्॥९॥
matched_target_text: रत्नशैवलसंघातां वज्रप्राकारमालिनीम्। रथ्यास्रोतोजलावर्तो चत्वरस्तिमिनहदाम्॥
english_translation: The Dwraka-river had the Vrishnis and the Andhakas for its water, horses for its fishes, cars for its rafts, the sound of musical instruments and the rattle of cars for its wayes, houses and mansions and public squares for its lakes. Games and precious stones were its moss. The walls of adamant were the garlands of flowers that floated on it. The streets and roads were the strong currents running in eddies along its surface. The great open squares were the large lakes in its course. Rama and Krishna were its two mighty alligators. That agreeable river now seemed to Arjuna to be the dreadful Vaitarani bound up with Time's net.

source_text: ददर्श वासविर्धीमान्विहीनां वृष्णिपुङ्गवैः। गतश्रियं निरानन्दां पद्मिनी शिशिरे यथा॥११॥
matched_target_text: ददर्श वासविर्धीमान् विहीनां वृष्णिपुङ्गवैः। गतश्रियं निरानन्दा पद्मिनी शिशिरे यथा॥
english_translation: Indeed, the son of Vasava, gifted with great intelligence, beheld the city to look even thus, reft as it was of the Vrishni heroes.

source_text: तां दृष्ट्वा द्वारकां पार्थस्ताश्च कृष्णस्य योषितः। सस्वनं बाष्पमुत्सृज्य निपपात महीतले॥१२॥

ce_reference.text: तां दृष्ट्वा द्वारकां पार्थस्ताश्च कृष्णस्य योषितः सस्वनं बाष्पमुत्सृज्य निपपात महीतले

source_text: सात्राजिती ततः सत्या रुक्मिणी च विशाम्पते। अभिपत्य प्ररुरुदुः परिवार्य धनञ्जयम्॥१३॥
matched_target_text: सात्राजिती ततः सत्या रुक्मिणी च विशाम्पते। अभिपत्य प्ररुरुदुः परिवार्य धनञ्जयम्॥
english_translation: Then Satya the daughter of Satrajit, and Rukmini too, O king, fell down beside Dhananjaya and bewailed.

source_text: ततस्तं काञ्चने पीठे समुत्थाप्योपवेश्य च। अब्रुवन्त्यो महात्मानं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे॥१४॥
matched_target_text: ततस्तं काञ्चने पीठे समुत्थाप्योपवेश्य च। अब्रुवन्त्यो महात्मानं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे॥
english_translation: Raising him then they caused him to be seated on a golden seat. The ladies sat around that great one, giving expression to their feelings.

source_text: ततः संस्तूय गोविन्दं कथयित्वा च पाण्डवः। आश्वास्य ताः स्त्रियश्चापि मातुलं द्रष्टुमभ्यगात्॥१५॥
matched_target_text: ततः संस्तूय गोविन्दं कथयित्वा च पाण्डवः। आश्वास्य ताः स्त्रियश्चापि मातुलं द्रष्टुमभ्यगात्॥
english_translation: Praising Govinda and talking with the ladies, the son of Pandu comforted them and then proceeded to see his maternal uncle.

source_text:
वैशम्पायन उवाच।
              तं शयानं महात्मानं वीरमानकदुन्दुभिम्। पुत्रशोकेन सन्तप्तं ददर्श कुरुपुङ्गवः॥१॥
matched_target_text: वैशम्पायन उवाच तं शयानं महात्मानं वीरमानकदुन्दुभिम्। पुत्रशोकेन संतप्तं ददर्श कुरुपुङ्गवः॥
english_translation: Vaishampayana said, The Kuru prince saw the heroic and great Anakadundubhi lying on the ground, and burning with grief on account of his sons.

source_text: तस्याश्रुपरिपूर्णाक्षो व्यूढोरस्को महाभुजः। आर्तस्यार्ततरः पार्थः पादौ जग्राह भारत॥२॥
matched_target_text: तस्याश्रुपरिपूर्णाक्षो व्यूढोरस्को महाभुजः। आर्तस्यार्ततरः पार्थः पादौ जग्राह भारत॥
english_translation: The broad-chested and mighty-armed son of Pritha, more afflicted than his uncle with his eyes bathed in tears, touched his uncle's feet, O Bharata.

source_text: तस्य मूर्धानमाघ्रातुमियेषानकदुन्दुभिः। स्वस्त्रीयस्य महाबाहुर्न शशाक च शत्रुहन्॥३॥
matched_target_text: तस्य मूर्धानमाघ्रातुमियेषानकदुन्दुभिः। स्वस्रीयस्य महाबाहुर्न शशाक च शत्रुहन्॥
english_translation: The mighty-armed Anakadundubhi wished to smell the head of his sister's son, but could not do it, O destroyer of enemies.

source_text: समालिङ्ग्यार्जुनं वृद्धः स भुजाभ्यां महाभुजः। रुदन्पुत्रान्स्मरन्सर्वान् विललाप सुविह्वलः॥४॥
matched_target_text: समालिङ्गग्यार्जुनं वृद्धः स भुजाभ्यां महाभुजः। रुदन् पुत्रान् स्मरन् सर्वान् विललाप सुविह्वलः॥ भ्रातन पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च दौहित्रान् ससखीनपि।
english_translation: The old man of mighty-arms, deeply afflicted embraced Partha with his arms and wept aloud, remembering his sons, brothers grandsons, daughter's sons, and friends.

source_text:
भ्रातॄन्पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च दौहित्रान् ससखीनपि।
              वसुदेव उवाच।
              यैर्जिता भूमिपालाश्च दैत्याश्च शतशोऽर्जुन॥५॥
matched_target_text: वासुदेव उवाच यैर्जिता भूमिपालाश्च दैत्याश्च शतशोऽर्जुन॥ तान् दृष्ट्वा नेह पश्यामि जीवाम्यर्जुन दुर्मरः।
english_translation: Vasudeva said Without seeing those heroes, O Arjuna who had subjugated all the kings of the Earth and the Daityas a hundred time, I am still alive! I see, that I cannot die!

source_text: तान् दृष्ट्वा नेह पश्यामि जीवाम्यर्जुन दुर्मरः। यौ तावर्जुन शिष्यौ ते प्रियौ बहुमतौ सदा॥६॥
matched_target_text: यौ तावर्जुन शिष्यौ ते प्रियौ बहुमतौ सदा तयोरपनयात्पार्थ वृष्णयो निधनं गताः

ce_reference.text: यौ तावर्जुन शिष्यौ ते प्रियौ बहुमतौ सदा तयोरपनयात्पार्थ वृष्णयो निधनं गताः

source_text: तयोरपनयात्पार्थ वृष्णयो निधनं गताः। यौ तौ वृष्णिप्रवीराणां द्वावेवातिरथौ मतौ॥७॥
matched_target_text: यौ तावर्जुन शिष्यौ ते प्रियौ बहुमतौ सदा॥ तयोरपनयात् पार्थ वृष्णयो निधनं गताः।
english_translation: Those two heroes who were the dear disciples of Arjuna, and who were much were course respected by him, alas, O Partha, through their fault, the Vrishnis have been destroyed.

source_text: प्रद्युम्नो युयुधानश्च कथयन्कत्थसे च यौ। तौ सदा कुरुशार्दूल कृष्णस्य प्रियभाजनौ॥८॥
matched_target_text: प्रद्युस्रो युयुधानश्च कथयन् कत्थसे च यौ। तौ सदा कुरुशार्दूल कृष्णस्य प्रियभाजनौ॥
english_translation: Those two who considered as Atirathas amongst the foremost of the Vrishnis, and referring to whom in of conversation you were wont to indulge in pride, and who, O chief of Kuru's race, were ever dear to Krishna himself, alas, those tow, O Dhananjaya, have been the chief causes of the Destruction of the Vrishnis.

source_text: तावुभौ वृष्णिनाशस्य मुखमास्तां धनञ्जय। न तु गर्हामि शैनेयं हार्दिक्यं चाहमर्जुन॥९॥
matched_target_text: तावुभौ वृष्णिनाशस्य मुखमास्तां धनञ्जय।
english_translation: Those two who considered as Atirathas amongst the foremost of the Vrishnis, and referring to whom in of conversation you were wont to indulge in pride, and who, O chief of Kuru's race, were ever dear to Krishna himself, alas, those tow, O Dhananjaya, have been the chief causes of the Destruction of the Vrishnis.

source_text: अक्रूरं रौक्मिणेयं च शापो ह्येवात्र कारणम्। केशिनं यस्तु कंसं च विक्रम्य जगतः प्रभुः॥१०॥
matched_target_text: तु गर्हामि शैनेयं हार्दिक्यं चाहमर्जुन॥ अक्रूरं रौक्मिणेयं च शापो ह्येवात्र कारणम्।
english_translation: I do not censure the son of Shini or the son of Hridika, O Arjuna! I do not censure Akrura or the son of Rukmini. No doubt, the curse (of the Rishis) is the sole cause.

source_text: विदेहावकरोत्पार्थ चैद्यं च बलगर्वितम्। नैषादिमेकलव्यं च चक्रे कालिङगमागधान्॥११॥
matched_target_text: विदेहावकरोत् पार्थ चैद्यं च बलगर्वितम्। नैषादिमेकलव्यं च चक्रे कालिङ्गमागधान्॥
english_translation: How is it what that lord of the universe, viz., the destroyer of Madhu, who had shown his prowess for killing Keshin, Kansa, and Chaidya swelling with pride, and Ekalavya the son of the king of the Nishadas, and the Kalingas and the Magadhas, and the Gandharas and the king of Kashi, and many rulers assembled together in the midst of the desert, many heroes belonging to the East and the South, and many kings of the mountainous regions, alas, how could he remain indifferent to such a calamity as the curse denounced by the Rishis?

source_text: गान्धारान्काशिराजं च मरुभूमौ च पार्थिवान्। प्राच्यांश्च दाक्षिणात्यांश्च पार्वतीयांस्तथा नृपान्॥१२॥
matched_target_text: गान्धारान् काशिराजं च मरुभूमौ च पार्थिवान्। प्राच्यांश्च दाक्षिणात्यांश्च पर्वतीयांस्तथा नृपान्॥
english_translation: How is it what that lord of the universe, viz., the destroyer of Madhu, who had shown his prowess for killing Keshin, Kansa, and Chaidya swelling with pride, and Ekalavya the son of the king of the Nishadas, and the Kalingas and the Magadhas, and the Gandharas and the king of Kashi, and many rulers assembled together in the midst of the desert, many heroes belonging to the East and the South, and many kings of the mountainous regions, alas, how could he remain indifferent to such a calamity as the curse denounced by the Rishis?

source_text: सोऽभ्युपेक्षितवानेतमनयान्मधुसूदनः। त्वं हि तं नारदश्चैव मुनयश्च सनातनम्॥१३॥
matched_target_text: त्वं हि तं नारदश्चैव मुनयश्च सनातनम्॥ गोविन्दमनघं देवमभिजानीध्वमच्युतम्।
english_translation: Yourself, Narada, and the Munis, knew him to be the eternal and sinless Govinda, the Deity of unfading glory.

source_text: गोविन्दमनघं देवमभिजानीध्वमच्युतम्। प्रत्यपश्यच्च स विभुर्ज्ञातिक्षयमधोक्षजः॥१४॥
matched_target_text: त्वं हि तं नारदश्चैव मुनयश्च सनातनम्॥ गोविन्दमनघं देवमभिजानीध्वमच्युतम्।
english_translation: Yourself, Narada, and the Munis, knew him to be the eternal and sinless Govinda, the Deity of unfading glory.

source_text: समुपेक्षितवान्नित्यं स्वयं स मम पुत्रकः। गान्धार्यां वचनं यत्तदृषीणां च परन्तप॥१५॥
matched_target_text: प्रत्यपश्यच्च स विभुञ्जतिक्षयमधोक्षजः॥ समुपेक्षितवान् नित्यं स्वयं स मम पुत्रकः।
english_translation: Alas, being powerful Vishnu himself, he saw without interfering, the destruction of his kinsmen! My son must have himself allowed all this to happen.

source_text: तन्नूनमन्यथा कर्तुं नैच्छत्स जगतः प्रभुः। प्रत्यक्षं भवतश्चापि तव पौत्रः परन्तप॥१६॥
matched_target_text: गान्धार्या वचनं यत् तदृषीणां च परंतप॥ तन्नूनमन्यथा कर्तुं नैच्छत् स जगतः प्रभुः।
english_translation: He was the Lord of the universe. He did not, however, wish to falsity the words of Gandhari and the Rishis, o destroyer of enemies.

source_text: अश्वत्थाम्ना हतश्चापि जीवितस्तस्य तेजसा। इमांस्तुनैच्छत्स्वान् ज्ञातीन् रक्षितुं च सखा तव॥१७॥
matched_target_text: प्रत्यक्षं भवतश्चापि तव पौत्रः परंतप॥ अश्वत्थाम्ना हतश्चापि जीवितस्तस्य तेजसा।
english_translation: Before the very eyes, O hero, your grandson, who had been killed by Ashvatthaman was revived through his energy.

source_text: ततः पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च भ्रातॄनथ सखींस्तथा। शयानान्निहतान्दृष्ट्वा ततो मामब्रवीदिदम्॥१८॥
matched_target_text: ततः पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च भ्रातॄनथ सखीनपि शयानान्निहतान्दृष्ट्वा ततो मामब्रवीदिदम्

ce_reference.text: ततः पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च भ्रातॄनथ सखीनपि शयानान्निहतान्दृष्ट्वा ततो मामब्रवीदिदम्

sarit_reference.text: ततः पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च भ्रातॄनथ सखींस्तथा । शयानान्निहतान्दृष्ट्वा कृष्णो मामब्रवीदिदम् ॥

source_text: सम्प्राप्तोऽद्यायमस्यान्तः कुलस्य भरतर्षभ। आगमिष्यति बीभत्सुरिमां द्वारवतीं पुरीम्॥१९॥
matched_target_text:
सम्प्राप्तोऽद्यायमस्यान्तः कुलस्य भरतर्षभ ।
							आगमिष्यति बीभत्सुरिमां द्वारवतीं पुरीम् । आख्येयं तस्य यद्वृत्तं वृष्णीनां वैशसं महत् ॥

sarit_reference.text:
सम्प्राप्तोऽद्यायमस्यान्तः कुलस्य भरतर्षभ ।
							आगमिष्यति बीभत्सुरिमां द्वारवतीं पुरीम् । आख्येयं तस्य यद्वृत्तं वृष्णीनां वैशसं महत् ॥

ce_reference.text: संप्राप्तोऽद्यायमस्यान्तः कुलस्य पुरुषर्षभ आगमिष्यति बीभत्सुरिमां द्वारवतीं पुरीम्

source_text: आख्येयं तस्य यद्वृत्तं वृष्णीनां वैशसं महत्। स तु श्रुत्वा महातेजा यदूनां निधनं प्रभो॥२०॥
matched_target_text: आगमिष्यति बीभत्सुरिमां द्वारवतीं पुरीम्॥ आख्येयं तस्य यद् वृत्तं वृष्णीनां वैशसं महत्।
english_translation: Vibhatsa will come to this city, viz., Dvaravati. Tell him what has taken place viz., this great destruction of the Vrishnis.

source_text: आगन्ता क्षिप्रमेवेह न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा। योऽहं तमर्जुनं विद्धि योऽर्जुनः सोहमेव तु॥२१॥
matched_target_text: स तु श्रुत्वा महातेजा यदूनां निधनं प्रभो॥ आगन्ता क्षिप्रमेवेह न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा।
english_translation: I have no doubt that as soon as he will hear of the destruction of the Yadus, that hero of mighty energy will come here forthwith.

source_text: यद्ब्रूयात्तत्तथा कार्यमिति बुत्ध्यस्व भारत। स स्त्रीषु प्राप्तकालासुपाण्डवो बालकेषु च॥२२॥
matched_target_text: योऽहं तमर्जुनं विद्धि योऽर्जुनः सोऽहमेव तु॥ यद् ब्रूयात् तत् तथा कार्यमिति बुद्ध्यस्व भारत।
english_translation: Know, O father, that I Arjuna and Arjuna is myself. That should be down by you which he would say.

source_text: प्रतिपत्स्यति बीभत्सुर्भवतश्चौर्ध्वदेहिकम्। इमां च नगरीं सद्यः प्रतियाते धनञ्जये॥२३॥
matched_target_text: स स्त्रीषु प्राप्तकालासु पाण्डवो बालकेषु च॥ प्रतिपत्स्यति बीभत्सुर्भवतश्चौर्ध्वदेहिकम्।
english_translation: Tile son of Pandu will do what is best for the women and the children. Even he will perform your funeral rites.

source_text: प्राकाराट्टालकोपेतां समुद्रः प्लावयिष्यति। अहं देशे तु कस्मिंश्चित्पुण्ये नियममास्थितः॥२४॥
matched_target_text: इमां च नगरी सद्यः प्रतियाते धनञ्जये॥ प्राकाराट्टालकोपेतां समुद्रः प्लावयिष्यति।
english_translation: This city of Dvaravati, after Arjuna's departure, will, with its walls and edifices, be speedily swallowed up by the ocean.

source_text: कालं कर्ता सत्य एव रामेण सह धीमता। एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशो मामचिंत्यपराक्रमः॥२५॥
matched_target_text: अहं देशे तु कस्मिंश्चित् पुण्ये नियममास्थितः॥ कालं कर्ता सत्य एव रामेण सह धीमता।
english_translation: As for myself retiring to some sacred place, I shall pass my time with the intelligent Rama in my company, observing strict vows all the while.

source_text: हित्वा मां बालकैः सार्धं दिशं कामप्यगात्प्रभुः। सोऽहं तौ च महात्मानौ चिंतयन्भ्रातरौ तव॥२६॥
matched_target_text: एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशो मामचिन्त्यपराक्रमः॥ हित्वा मां बालकैः सार्धं दिशं कामप्यगात् प्रभुः।
english_translation: Having said these words to me, Hrishikesha of inconceivable prowess, leaving me with the children, has gone away some where which I do not know.

source_text: घोरं ज्ञातिवधं चैव न भुञ्जे शोककर्शितः। न मोक्षे न च जिविष्ये दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि पाण्डव॥२७॥
matched_target_text: सोऽहं तौ च महात्मानौ चिन्तयन् भ्रातरौ तव।॥ घोरं ज्ञातिवधं चैव न भुञ्जे शोककर्शितः।
english_translation: Thinking of those two great brothers of yours as also of the dreadful destruction of my kinsmen, I have abstained from all food, and am emaciated with grief.

source_text: यदुक्तं पार्थ कृष्णेन तत्सर्वमखिलं कुरु। एतत्ते पार्थ राज्यं च स्त्रियो रत्नानि चैव हि। इष्टान्प्राणानहं हीमांस्त्यक्ष्यामि रिपुसूदन॥२८॥
matched_target_text: एतत्ते पार्थ राज्यं च स्त्रियो रत्नानि चैव हि । इष्टान्प्राणानहं हीमांस्त्यक्ष्यामि रिपुसूदन ॥ ॥

sarit_reference.text: एतत्ते पार्थ राज्यं च स्त्रियो रत्नानि चैव हि । इष्टान्प्राणानहं हीमांस्त्यक्ष्यामि रिपुसूदन ॥ ॥

ce_reference.text: एतत्ते पार्थ राज्यं च स्त्रियो रत्नानि चैव ह इष्टान्प्राणानहं हीमांस्त्यक्ष्यामि रिपुसूदन

source_text:
वैशम्पायन उवाच।
              एवमुक्तः स बीभत्सुर्मातुलेन परंतप। दुर्मना दीनवदनो वसुदेवमुवाचह॥१॥
matched_target_text: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तः स बीभत्सुर्मातुलेन परंतप। दुर्मना दीनवदनो वसुदेवमुवाच ह॥
english_translation: Vaishampayana said, That scorcher of enemies, viz., Bibhatsu, thus addressed by his maternal uncle, replied, with great cheerlessness of heart, to Vasudeva who was equally cheerless, saying, 'O uncle, I ma unable to look at this Earth when she is reft of that hero of Vrishni' rare and those my other kinsmen.

source_text: नाहं वृष्णिप्रवीरेण बन्धुभिश्चैव मातुल। विहीनां पृथिवीं द्रष्टुं शक्यामीह कथञ्चन॥२॥
matched_target_text: नाहं वृष्णिप्रवीरेण बन्धुभिश्चैव मातुल। विहीनां पुथिवीं द्रष्टुं शक्यामीह कथंचन।॥
english_translation: Vaishampayana said, That scorcher of enemies, viz., Bibhatsu, thus addressed by his maternal uncle, replied, with great cheerlessness of heart, to Vasudeva who was equally cheerless, saying, 'O uncle, I ma unable to look at this Earth when she is reft of that hero of Vrishni' rare and those my other kinsmen.

source_text: राजा च भीमसेनश्च सहदेवश्च पांडवः। नकुलो याज्ञसेनी च षडेकमनसो वयम्॥३॥
matched_target_text: राजा च भीमसेनश्च सहदेवश्च पाण्डवः। नकुलो याज्ञसेनी च षडेकमनसो वयम्॥
english_translation: The king and Bhimasena and Sahadeva and Nakula and Yajnaseni, are of the same mind with myself in this matter.

source_text: राज्ञः सङ्क्रमणे चापि कालोऽयं वर्तते ध्रुवम्। तमिमं विद्धि सम्प्राप्तं कालं कालविदां वर॥४॥
matched_target_text: राज्ञः संक्रमणे चापि कालोऽयं वर्तते ध्रुवम्। तमिमं विद्धि सम्प्राप्तं कालं कालविदां वर॥
english_translation: The time has come for the departure of the king also. Know this that the hour of our departure too is near. You are the foremost of those who are well conversant with the course of time.

source_text: सर्वथा वृष्णिदारास्तु बालं वृद्धं तथैव च। नयिष्ये परिगृह्याहमिन्द्रप्रस्थमरिन्दम॥५॥
matched_target_text: सर्वथा वृष्णिदारास्तु बालं वृद्धं तथैव च। नयिष्ये परिगृह्याहमिन्द्रप्रस्थमरिंदम॥
english_translation: I shall, however, O chastiser of enemies, first remove to Indraprastha the women of the Vrishni race as also the children and the aged.'

source_text: इत्युक्त्वा दारुकमिदं वाक्यमाह धनञ्जयः। अमात्यान्वृष्णिवीराणां द्रष्टुमिच्छामि मा चिरम्॥६॥
matched_target_text: इत्युक्त्वा दारुकमिदं वाक्यमाह धनञ्जयः। अमात्यान् वृष्णिवीराणां द्रष्टुमिच्छामि मा चिरम्।।६।
english_translation: Having said so to his uncle, Arjuna, next addressed Daruka, saying, I wish to see forthwith the chief officers of the Vrishni heroes.

source_text: इत्येवमुक्त्वा वचनं सुधर्मां यादवीं सभाम्। प्रविवेशार्जुनः शूरः शोचमानो महारथान्॥७॥

english_translation: That foremost of car-warriors, that conqueror of hostile towns viz., the son of Pritha, escorted this huge procession of Vrishnis, which still abounded with wealth, and which looked like a veritable ocean.

source_text: निर्याते तु जने तस्मिन्सागरो मकरालयः। द्वारकां रत्नसम्पूर्णां जलेनाप्लावयत्तदा॥४१॥

english_translation: After all the people had started, the ocean, the home of sharks, and alligators, flooded Dwraka, which still teemed with riches of every kind, with its waters.

english_translation: Dhananjaya, after abandoning Dwraka, proceeded by slow marches, causing the Vrishni women to rest in charming forests and mountain and by the sides of delightful rivers.

english_translation: Have you been defeated in battle? You look like one shorn of prosperity! I do not know that you have been defeated by any one. Why then, O chief Bharata's race, this exceedingly dejected look! You should O of Pritha, tell me all, if, indeed, there be no harm in telling it.

source_text:

matched_target_text: अर्जुन उवाच यः स मेघवपुः श्रीमान् बृहत्पंकजलोचनः॥
english_translation: Arjuna said He whose complexion was like that of a cloud, he whose eyes were like pair of large lotus petals, viz., Krishna has, with Rama, renounced his body and ascended to heaven.

english_translation: Arjuna said He whose complexion was like that of a cloud, he whose eyes were like pair of large lotus petals, viz., Krishna has, with Rama, renounced his body and ascended to heaven.

source_text: बभूव वीरान्तकरः प्रभासे लोमहर्षणः। एते शूरा महात्मानः सिंहदर्पा महाबलाः॥९॥

english_translation: At Prabhasa, through iron bolts caused by the curse denounced by Brahmanas, the destruction has taken place of the Vrishni heroes. That destruction has been awful and not even a single hero has escaped,

source_text: भोजवृष्ण्यन्धका ब्रह्मन्नन्योन्यं तैर्हतं युधि। गदापरिघशक्तीनां सहाः परिघबाहवः॥१०॥
matched_target_text: भोजवृष्ण्यन्धका ब्रह्मन्नन्योन्यं तैर्हतं युधि। गदापरिघशक्तीनां सहाः परिघबाहवः॥
english_translation: The heroes of the Bhoja, the Andhaka, and the Vrishni races, O Brahmana, who were all gifted with high-souls, great might, and leonine pride, have killed one another in battle. Possessed of arms which looked like maces of iron, and capable of bearing the strokes of heavy clubs and darts, alas they have all been killed with blades of Eraka grass. See the perverse course of Time. Five hundred thousand mighty-armed warriors have thus been killed. Encountering one another, they have met with destruction.

source_text: त एरकाभिर्निहिताः पश्य कालस्य पर्ययम्। हतं पञ्चशतं तेषां सहस्रं बाहुशालिनाम्॥११॥

source_text: चिन्तयानो यदूनां च कृष्णस्य च यशस्विनः। शोषणं सागरस्येव पर्वतस्येव चालनम्॥१३॥

english_translation: Thinking repeatedly of this destruction of the Yadava warriors of immeasurable energy and of the illustrious Krishna, I cannot get peace of mind.

source_text: नभसः पतनं चैव शैत्यमग्नेस्तथैव च। अश्रद्धेयमहं मन्ये विनाशं शार्ङ्गधन्वनः॥१४॥
matched_target_text: नभसः पतनं चैव शैत्यमग्नेस्तथैव च। अश्रद्धेयमहं मन्ये विनाशं शार्ङ्गधन्वनः॥
english_translation: The death of the holder of Sharnga is as incredible as the drying up of the ocean, the displacement of a mountain, the falling down of the heaven, or the cooling property of fie. Deprived of the company of the Vrishni heroes, I wish not to live in this world.

source_text: न चेह स्थातुमिच्छामि लोके कृष्णविनाकृतः। इतः कष्टतरं चान्यच्छृणु तद्वै तपोधन॥१५॥

english_translation: The death of the holder of Sharnga is as incredible as the drying up of the ocean, the displacement of a mountain, the falling down of the heaven, or the cooling property of fie. Deprived of the company of the Vrishni heroes, I wish not to live in this world.

source_text: मनो मे दीर्यते येन चिन्तयानस्य वै मुहुः। पश्यतो वृष्णिदाराश्च मम ब्रह्मन् सहस्रशः॥१६॥
matched_target_text: इतः कष्टतरं चान्यच्छृणु तद् वै तपोधन॥ मनो मे दीर्यते येन चिन्तयानस्य वै मुहुः।
english_translation: Another event has taken place that is more painful than this, O you having penances for wealth. Repeatedly thinking of it, my heart is breaking.

source_text: आभीरैरनुसृत्याजौ हृताः पञ्चनदालयैः। धनुरादाय तत्राहं नाशकं तस्य पूरणे॥१७॥
matched_target_text: पश्यतो वृष्णिदाराश्च मम ब्रह्मन् सहस्रशः॥ आभीरैरनुसृत्याजौ हताः पञ्चनदालयैः।
english_translation: In my very sight, O Brahmana, thousands of Vrishni ladies were carried away by the Abhiras of the country of the five waters, who attacked us.

source_text: यथा पुरा च मे वीर्यं भुजयोर्न तथाऽभवत्। अस्त्राणि मे प्रनष्टानि त्रिविधानि महामुने॥१८॥
matched_target_text: धनुरादाय तत्राहं नाशकं तस्य पूरणे॥ यथा पुरा च मे वीर्यं भुजयोर्न तथाऽभवत्।
english_translation: Taking up my bow, I found myself unequal to even string it. The power that had existed in my arms seemed to have disappeared on that occasion.

source_text: शराश्च क्षयमापन्नाः क्षणेनैव समन्ततः। पुरुषश्चाप्रमेयात्मा शङ्खचक्रगदाधरः॥१९॥
matched_target_text: अस्त्राणि मे प्रनष्टानि विविधानि महामुने॥ शराश्च क्षयमापन्नाः क्षणेनैव समन्ततः।
english_translation: O great ascetic, my weapons of various kinds failed to appear. Soon, again, my arrows became exhausted.

source_text: चतुर्भुजः पीतवासाः श्यामः पद्मदलेक्षणः। यश्च याति पुरस्तान्मे रथस्य सुमहाद्युतिः॥२०॥
matched_target_text: चतुर्भुजः पीतवासाः श्यामः पद्मदलेक्षणः। यश्च याति पुरस्तान्मे रथस्य सुमहाद्युतिः॥
english_translation: That person of immeasurable soul, of four arms, holding the conch, the discus, and the mace, clad in yellow robes, dark of complexion, and possessing eyes resembling lotus-petals, is no longer seen by me! Alas, reft of Govinda, what have I to live for, dragging my life in sorrow?

source_text: प्रदहन् रिपुसैन्यानि न पश्याम्यहमच्युतम्। येन पूर्वं प्रदग्धानि शत्रुसैन्यानि तेजसा॥२१॥
matched_target_text: प्रदहन रिपुसैन्यानि न पश्याम्यहमच्युतम्। येन पूर्वं प्रदग्धानि शत्रूसैन्यानि तेजसा॥
english_translation: He who used to stalk in advance of my car, that divine form gifted with great splendour and unfading power, consuming as he proceeded all hostile warriors, can no longer be seen by me.

source_text: शरैर्गाण्डीवनिर्मुक्तैरहं पश्चाच्च नाशयम्। तमपश्यन्विषीदामि घूर्णामीव च सत्तम॥२२॥
matched_target_text: शरैर्गाण्डीवनिर्मुक्तैरहं पश्चाच्च नाशयम्। तमपश्यन् विषीदामि घूर्णामीव च सत्तम॥
english_translation: No longer seeing him who by his energy first burnt all hostile troops whom I afterwards killed with arrows shot off Gandiva, I am filled with grief and my head swims, O best of men! Penetrated with cheerlessness and despair, I cannot get peace of mind.

source_text: परिनिर्विण्णचेताश्च शान्ति नोपलभेऽपि च। विना जनार्दनं वीरं नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे॥२३॥
matched_target_text: विना जनार्दनं वीरं नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे॥ श्रुत्वैव हि गतं विष्णुं ममापि मुमुहुर्दिशः।
english_translation: I dare not live, reft of the heroic Janardana. As soon as I heard that Vishnu had left the earth, my eyes became dim and all things disappeared from my vision.

source_text: श्रुत्वैव हि गतं विष्णुं ममापि मुमुहुर्दिशः। प्रनष्टज्ञातिवीर्यस्य शून्यस्य परिधावतः॥२४॥
matched_target_text: विना जनार्दनं वीरं नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे॥ श्रुत्वैव हि गतं विष्णुं ममापि मुमुहुर्दिशः।
english_translation: I dare not live, reft of the heroic Janardana. As soon as I heard that Vishnu had left the earth, my eyes became dim and all things disappeared from my vision.

source_text:
उपदेष्टुं मम श्रेयो भवानर्हति सत्तम।
              व्यास उवाच।
              ब्रह्मशापविनिर्दग्धा वृष्ण्यन्धकमहारथाः॥२५॥
matched_target_text: उपदेष्टुं मम श्रेयो भवानर्हति सत्तम ॥ व्यास उवाच ।

sarit_reference.text: उपदेष्टुं मम श्रेयो भवानर्हति सत्तम ॥ व्यास उवाच ।

ce_reference.text: प्रनष्टज्ञातिवीर्यस्य शून्यस्य परिधावतः उपदेष्टुं मम श्रेयो भवानर्हति सत्तम

source_text: विनष्टाः कुरुशार्दूल न तान् शोचितुमर्हसि। भवितव्यं तथा तच्च दिष्टमेतन्महात्मनाम्॥२६॥
matched_target_text: व्यास उवाच ब्रह्मशापविनिर्दग्धा वृष्ण्यन्धकमहारथाः॥ विनष्टाः कुरुशार्दूल न ताशोचितुमर्हसि।
english_translation: Vyasa said The powerful car-warriors of the Vrishni and the Andhaka races have all been consumed by the Brahmanas' course. O chief of Kuru's race, you should not grieve for their destruction.

source_text: उपेक्षितं च कृष्णेन शक्तेनापि व्यपोहितुम्। त्रैलोक्यमपि गोविंदः कृत्स्नं स्थावरजङ्गमम्॥२७॥
matched_target_text: भवितव्यं तथा तच्च दिष्टमेतन्महात्मनाम्॥ उपेक्षितं च कृष्णेन शक्तेनापि व्यपोहितुम्।
english_translation: That which has taken place, had been ordained. It was the destiny of those great warriors. Krishna allowed it to take place although he was fully competent to befell it.

source_text: प्रसहेदन्यथाकर्तुं कुतः शापं महात्मनाम्। रथस्य पुरतो याति यः सचक्रगदाधरः॥२८॥
matched_target_text: त्रैलोक्यमपि गोविन्दः कृत्स्नं स्थावरजङ्गमम्॥ प्रसहेदन्यथाकर्तुं कुतः शापं महात्मनाम्।
english_translation: Govinda was able to after the very course of the universe with all its mobile and immobile creatures. What need then be said of the curse of even great Brahmanas?

source_text: तव स्नेहात्पुराणर्षिर्वासुदेवश्चतुर्भुजः। कृत्वा भारावतरणं पृथिव्याः पृथुलोचनः॥२९॥
matched_target_text: रथस्य पुरतो याति यः स चक्रगदाधरः॥ तव स्नेहात् पुराणर्षिर्वासुदेवश्चतुर्भुज।
english_translation: for you He who used to proceed in front of your car, arined with discus and mace, through affection was the four-armed Vasudeva, that ancient Rishi.

source_text: मोक्षयित्वा तनुं प्राप्तः कृष्णः स्वस्थानमुत्तमम्। त्वयाऽपीह महत्कर्म देवानां पुरुषर्षभ॥३०॥
matched_target_text: कृत्वा भरावतरणं पृथिव्याः पृथुलोचनः॥ मोक्षयित्वा तनुं प्राप्तः कृष्णः स्वस्थानमुत्तमम्।
english_translation: That great one of expansive eyes, viz., Krishna, having lightened the burthen of the Earth and cast off his (human) body, has attained to his own high seat.

source_text: कृतं भीमसहायेन यमाभ्यां च महाभुज। कृतकृत्यांश्च वो मन्ये संसिद्धान्कुरुपुङ्गव॥३१॥
matched_target_text: त्वयापीह महत् कर्म देवानां पुरुषर्षभ॥ कृतं भीमसहायेन यमाभ्यां च महाभुज।
english_translation: By you also, O foremost of men, with Bhima for your helpmate and the twins, O mighty-armed hero, has the great work of the gods been done.

source_text: गमनं प्राप्तकालं व इदं श्रेयस्करं विभो। एवं बुद्धिश्च तेजश्च प्रतिपत्तिश्च भारत॥३२॥
matched_target_text: कृतकृत्यांश्च वो मन्ये संसिद्धान् कुरुपुङ्गव॥ गमनं प्राप्तकालं व इहं श्रेयस्कर विभो।
english_translation: O foremost one of Kuru's race, I regard you and your brothers as crowned with success, for you have accomplished the great purpose of your lives! The Time has come for your departure from the world. Even this, O powerful one, is what is beneficial for you now.

source_text: भवन्ति भवकालेषु विपद्यन्ते विपर्यये। कालमूलमिदं सर्वं जगद्बीजं धनञ्जय॥३३॥
matched_target_text: एवं बुद्धिश्च तेजश्च प्रतिपत्तिश्च भारता॥ भवन्ति भवकालेषु विपद्यन्ते विपर्यये।
english_translation: Even thus, understanding and prowess and foresight. O Bharata, arise when days of prosperity have gone. These very acquisitions disappear when the hour of adversity comes.

source_text: काल एव समादत्ते पुनरेव यदृच्छया। स एव बलवान्भूत्वा पुनर्भवति दुर्बलः॥३४॥
matched_target_text: कालमूलमिदं सर्वं जगद्बीजं धनञ्जय॥ काल एव समादत्ते पुनरेव यदृच्छया।
english_translation: All this has Time for its root. Time is, indeed, the seed of the of the universe, O not FINISH MA Dhananjaya! It is Time, again, which withdraws everything at its pleasure.

source_text: स एवेशश्च भूत्वेह परैराज्ञाप्यते पुनः। कृतकृत्यानि चास्त्राणि गतान्यद्य यथागतम्॥३५॥
matched_target_text: स एव बलवान् भूत्वा पुनर्भवति दुर्बलः॥ स एवेशश्च भूत्वेह परैराज्ञाप्यते पुनः।
english_translation: One becomes powerful, and, again, losing that power, becomes weak. One becomes a master and rules others, and again, losing that position, becomes a servant for obeying the order of others.

source_text: पुनरेष्यन्ति ते हस्ते यदा कालो भविष्यति। कालो गन्तुं गतिं मुख्यां भवतामपि भारत॥३६॥
matched_target_text: कृतकृत्यानि चास्त्राणि गतान्यद्य यथागतम्॥ पुनरेष्यन्ति ते हस्ते यदा कालो भविष्यति।
english_translation: Your weapons, having achieved success, have gone away to the place they came from. They will, again, come into your hands when the Time for their coming approaches.

source_text:
एतच्छ्रेयो हि वो मन्ये परमं भरतर्षभ।
              वैशम्पायन उवाच।
              एतद्वचनमाज्ञाय व्यासस्यामिततेजसः॥३७॥
matched_target_text: कालो गन्तुं गतिं मुख्यां भवतामपि भारत॥ एतच्छ्रेयो हि वो मन्ये परमं भरतर्षभ।
english_translation: The Time has come, O Bharata, for you all to attain to the highest end. This is what I consider to be highly beneficial for you all, O chief of Bharata's race.

source_text: अनुज्ञातो ययौ पार्थो नगरं नागसाह्वयम्। प्रविश्य च पुरी वीरा समासाद्य युधिष्ठिरम्। आचष्ट तद्यथावृत्तं वृष्ण्यन्धककुलं प्रति॥३८॥
matched_target_text: प्रविश्य च पुरीं वीरः समासाद्य युधिष्ठिरम् । आचष्ट तद्यथावृत्तं वृष्ण्यन्धककुलं प्रति ॥ ॥

sarit_reference.text: प्रविश्य च पुरीं वीरः समासाद्य युधिष्ठिरम् । आचष्ट तद्यथावृत्तं वृष्ण्यन्धककुलं प्रति ॥ ॥
